faq.title: Common Questions About Mazu
faq.description: Have a question? Check our GitHub or submit an issue.

items.title: Why is Mazu 2.5GB in total?
items.description: The app itself is 210MB, but the Gemma 3n AI model is 2.3GB. This is a complete AI brain that runs on your device - no internet needed. Think of it as downloading all the emergency knowledge you'll ever need.

items.title: How does offline AI actually work?
items.description: Mazu uses Google's Gemma 3n model in GGUF format, which is optimized for mobile devices. All AI processing happens on your phone's processor - no cloud servers, no internet connection required.

items.title: Which emergencies does Mazu support?
items.description: Mazu is trained on Red Cross protocols and emergency response guidelines. It covers earthquakes, fires, floods, hurricanes, medical emergencies, power outages, and general disaster scenarios.

items.title: What about battery usage?
items.description: Mazu is optimized for emergency use. In standby, it uses minimal battery. During active use, it's comparable to using a messaging app. We recommend keeping your phone charged as part of emergency preparedness.

items.title: Can I trust Mazu's advice?
items.description: Mazu follows established emergency protocols from organizations like the Red Cross. However, it's an AI assistant, not a replacement for professional emergency services. When available, always call official emergency numbers.

items.title: Is Mazu really free?
items.description: Yes, completely free. No subscriptions, no in-app purchases, no ads. This is our submission for the Google Gemma Developer Contest, built to help people in emergencies.
